manufacture.translation[0].definitions[0: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the company that manufactured the drug
manufacture.translation[0].definitions[1: to invent an untrue story, excuse etc
If the media can manufacture stories like this, who are we supposed to believe?
manufacture.translation[0].definitions[2: if your body manufactures a particular useful substance, it produces it
manufacture.translation[1].definitions[0: the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts
Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
manufacture.translation[2].definitions[0: to produce large quantities of goods to be sold, using machinery
Nike started as a small company manufacturing running shoes.
Imports of manufactured goods are increasing.
The drawers are manufactured from solid beech.
manufacture.translation[3].definitions[0: when large quantities of goods are produced to be sold, using machinery
Cigarettes become stale from one to three months after the date of manufacture.
machine tools used in the manufacture of aircraft engines
manufacture.translation[3].definitions[1: goods produced in large quantities using machinery
changes in exports and imports of manufactures
